page.title: 05Broome Heath
page.content: On the 17th we went to Broome. We crossed the heath where Mr.Weston dug a hole. It was bad soil for crops it had alot of sand & stones in it,but it is good for gravel, as proof there are gravel pits full of water & fish.One night during the war a spitfire crashed on the heath & you can still see an empty pit.The heath is peaceful to cross there are only the sounds of birds,dogs & people.There are humps which are called communial barrows.A_ long time ago the stone age people buried their dead & tools in these, they are rare & people who excavate them will be punished.We stopped at the old railway line & saw willow saplings that are taken to be made into the best cricket bats.Then we stopped at the water works it pumps water to Suffolk to be made into drinking water.Broome is a nice place.
